There are two big things looming on the horizon, though. The smaller one is the mass deployment of electric cars. This implies big political (because oil will no longer be so important) and environmental (much cleaner air in cities) change.The really big revolution might be the coming of AI. I’m not so sure about the pop-culture AI horrors of aggressive Skynet-like AI’s. What I have no doubt about, though, is that AI will be used commercially and various new AIs will (practically overnight) wipe out huge swathes of jobs. It’ll start with automatic cars replacing cab, bus and truck drivers. Then you’ll see things like AI translators replacing human translators, and if you think that’s a tiny change - computer programming, for example, is basically translating sets of commands from human to computerese. All those desk jobs will be gone. From there, we can move toward some socialist utopia with a guaranteed citizen salary, or into a corporate dystopia with the privileged few “AI owners” who have everything, a small middle class who serves them and vast population of the unemployed.
